" Nov. 1, 2018 2:45 p.m. News A cluster of private bus companies have stepped up to replace routes left vacant by Greyhound when it pulled out of Western Canada at midnight on Wednesday, Oct. 31.
Merritt Shuttle Bus Services has been approved to operate inter-city bus service (by reservation only) through six routes.
" Merritt Shuttle Bus Services has no website to speak of (yet), aside from its social media page.
One of its routes (Route E) will go from Merritt to Spences Bridge and up Highway 97 to Prince George, right through 100 Mile House.
One of its routes (Route E) will go from Merritt to Spences Bridge and up Highway 97 to Prince George, right through 100 Mile House.

" The company will also run routes from Lower Nicola to Kamloops, from Kamloops to Highland Valley, from Merritt to Highland Valley, from Merritt to Spences Bridge to Langley and from Merritt to Kelowna.
One of its routes (Route E) will go from Merritt to Spences Bridge and up Highway 97 to Prince George, right through 100 Mile House.
Company co-owner Gene Field said this express route will run three days a week - Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays - and if ridership dictates, it could become a daily trip.
" The company doesn't own the buses yet, but Field said he has seven shuttle buses lined up, plus possible investors with enough capital to fund them.
